body_html:
This should be a benign error: TensorFlow on Windows does not require pthreads to build or run—instead it uses C++11 threads, which are supported by the Windows C runtime library.

It should be possible to eliminate this error by wrapping the line find_package (Threads) in CMakeLists.txt in an if(UNIX) block.
body_text:
This should be a benign error: TensorFlow on Windows does not require pthreads to build or run—instead it uses C++11 threads, which are supported by the Windows C runtime library.
It should be possible to eliminate this error by wrapping the line find_package (Threads) in CMakeLists.txt in an if(UNIX) block.
body:
This should be a benign error: TensorFlow on Windows does not require pthreads to build or run—instead it uses C++11 threads, which are supported by the Windows C runtime library.

It should be possible to eliminate this error by wrapping the line `find_package (Threads)` in CMakeLists.txt in an `if(UNIX)` block.
